## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I'm trying to use the `getblockhashes` command to get the hashes of all blocks in the entire blockchain. Can you help me with that?

**AI Assistant:**
I'd be happy to help! However, I have to clarify that the `getblockhashes` command doesn't quite work the way you think it does. It doesn't return the hashes of all blocks in the entire blockchain. Instead, it returns an array of hashes of blocks within a specific timestamp range provided as arguments. You need to specify a `high` and `low` timestamp to define the range of blocks you're interested in.

**User:**
Oh, I see. Thanks for the clarification! But what if I want to get the hashes of blocks that are not on the main chain? Is that possible with `getblockhashes`?

**AI Assistant:**
Yes, you can use the `getblockhashes` command to get the hashes of blocks that are not on the main chain, but only if you set `"noOrphans":false` in the `options` argument. If you set `"noOrphans":true`, the command will only return hashes of blocks on the main chain. So, by setting `"noOrphans":false`, you can include blocks that are not part of the main chain in your query.
How do I use the `getblockhashes` command to get the hashes of all blocks in the entire blockchain?

The `getblockhashes` command does not return the hashes of all blocks in the entire blockchain. Instead, it returns an array of hashes of blocks within a specific timestamp range provided as arguments. You need to specify a `high` and `low` timestamp to define the range of blocks you're interested in.

getblockhashes timestamp

Returns array of hashes of blocks within the timestamp range provided.

Arguments:
1. high     (numeric, required) The newer block timestamp
2. low     (numeric, required) The older block timestamp
3. options   (string, required) A json object
  {
   "noOrphans":true  (boolean) will only include blocks on the main chain
   "logicalTimes":true  (boolean) will include logical timestamps with hashes
  }

Result:
[
 "hash"     (string) The block hash
]
[
 {
  "blockhash": (string) The block hash
  "logicalts": (numeric) The logical timestamp
 }
]

Examples:
> verus getblockhashes 1231614698 1231024505
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblockhashes", "params": [1231614698, 1231024505] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
> verus getblockhashes 1231614698 1231024505 '{"noOrphans":false, "logicalTimes":true}'
Can I use the `getblockhashes` command to get the hashes of blocks that are not on the main chain?

Yes, you can use the `getblockhashes` command to get the hashes of blocks that are not on the main chain, but only if you set `"noOrphans":false` in the `options` argument. If you set `"noOrphans":true`, the command will only return hashes of blocks on the main chain.
